intro: Hieracium subpumilum, commonly known as the dwarf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are usually shorter than the leaves, and the flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium subpumilum is part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some species.
